contributions.title: Set up Prettier with Husky pre-commit hooks and GitHub Actions
contributions.description: Implemented automated code formatting with pre-commit hooks and CI integration to solve developer IDE formatting confusion
whatTheyAskedFor: Enable Prettier via Husky pre-commit hooks
Add GitHub Actions for prettier checks
Match Creative Commons Search Portal implementation
whatWeDelivered: Modern Husky v8+ pre-commit hook setup
GitHub Actions workflow for CI formatting checks
Prettier configuration matching CC Search Portal
challengesSolved: Analyzed git history to understand previous Vue.js -> vanilla JS refactor
Matched existing Creative Commons tooling patterns
Set up modern Husky configuration (v8+ syntax)
learningsAndInsights: Creative Commons moved from complex Vue.js build to simple vanilla JS
Modern Husky syntax different from legacy configurations
Importance of following project-specific ignore patterns
Value of testing pre-commit hooks before submission

contributions.title: Fix broken internal link in Jammy award announcement
contributions.description: Fixed a broken internal link that was using absolute URL instead of relative path, improving site reliability
whatTheyAskedFor: Fix broken links identified in issue #1478
Update links to use proper paths
whatWeDelivered: Fixed broken internal link in Jammy award announcement
Changed from absolute URL to relative path
Comprehensive analysis of all reported broken links
Found most links were already fixed in previous PRs
challengesSolved: Discovered most reported links were already fixed
Followed proper fork and PR etiquette
learningsAndInsights: Importance of checking if issues are still current
One PR per issue is best practice
Always use relative paths for internal links

contributions.title: Add automated broken link checker using Lychee
contributions.description: Implemented monthly automated link checking with GitHub Actions to prevent future broken links, using the tool specifically requested by maintainers
whatTheyAskedFor: Implement automated link checking in CI/CD pipeline
Use Lychee broken link checker (specifically requested)
Run periodically, not on every commit
Create single consolidated issue for broken links
whatWeDelivered: GitHub Actions workflow for monthly link checking
Automated issue creation with markdown reports
challengesSolved: Configured monthly scheduled runs with cron
Set up build step before link checking
Created smart exclusions for false positives
learningsAndInsights: Read issue discussions to find tool preferences
Separate PRs for different issues is crucial
Link checkers need careful false positive handling
